<summary>Notes</summary>
<br>

**Definion:** <br>Locally aggressive fibroblastic / myofibroblastic tumor without metastatic potential <br>
<br>
**Epidemiology and Localization:** <br> Mean age: 36 - 42 years 
<br><br>
**Microscopy:** <br> Bland spindle cells, typically with low mitotic activity. <br> Poorly defined. <br> Extravasated erythrocytes common. <br> May have myxoid, oedematous, or highly collagenous areas.
<br><br>

**Immunohistochemistry and molecular pathology:** <br> 90% CTNNB1 (exon 3 most common) and APC mutations . 

**Therapy and Prognosis:** <br> Recurrence in 20-30% <br>  May undergo spontaneous regression. <br> May be managed conservatively, with surgery, radio- or chemotherapy. Surgery may induce growth, if not completely removed. 


**References:** <br>https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissuefibromatosisdeep.html
